grammarNote.title: Sentence-Final Particles: ね and よ
grammarNote.explanation: ね and よ appear at the end of sentences and convey the speaker's attitude. ね seeks agreement or confirmation (like English 'right?' or 'isn't it?'): 楽しいね (Fun, isn't it?). よ asserts information the listener may not know, adding emphasis: あそぶよ！ (We're playing! / Let's play!). These particles make speech sound natural and are extremely common.

examples.japanese: ニンニ さん も あそぶ ね。

vocabulary.example: よう が 変わった！
木 の なか に いる か？
なに が 変わる？
今日 は みんな で あそぶ。
